snippet: Latinos are not voting in numbers that fully reflect their potential strength, leaving Hispanic leaders frustrated and Democrats worried as they increase efforts to rally Latino support.
abstract: Latinos are not registering to vote nor voting in numbers that fully reflect their potential strength, leaving Hispanic leaders frustrated and Democrats worried as they increase efforts to rally Latino support; rapidly growing Latino population is thought to be one of the most powerful forces working in Pres Obama’s favor in many of the states that will determine his contest with Mitt Romney.

byline.contributor: Marisa Gerber contributed reporting from Nogales, Ariz.; Dan Frosch from Colorado and New Mexico; and Susannah Nesmith from Miami.

lead_paragraph: Latinos are not voting in numbers that fully reflect their potential strength, leaving Hispanic leaders frustrated and Democrats worried as they increase efforts to rally Latino support.

headline.main: Latino Growth Not Fully Felt at Voting Booth
headline.print_headline: Latino Growth Not Fully Felt At Voting Booth
